Class Viewer

An extensible browser-based 3D viewer for AECO applications.

Summary
  • Fast, double precision 3D rendering, in all major browsers
  • Fast model loading from binary format
  • Multiple canvases
  • Super low memory footprint
  • Semantic data model
  • Open architecture

Overview

A Viewer has three main components:

  • Scene - Contains geometric representations of models, with materials, textures, transforms etc.
  • Data - Contains optional semantic data models (e.g. IFC elements and property sets).
  • Views - One or more independently-configurable canvases viewing the models in Scene.

We can also configure a Viewer with a custom Renderer strategy, in case we need to customize the way the Viewer uses the underlying browser graphics API (e.g. WebGL, WebGPU) to create and render models.

Examples

Example 1: Basic Viewer

Create a viewer:

import {Viewer, constants} from "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@xeokit/xeokit-viewer/dist/xeokit-viewer.es.min.js";

const myViewer = new Viewer({
    id: "myViewer"
});

Create a view:

const view1 = myViewer.createView({
    id: "myView",
    canvasId: "myCanvas1"
});

view1.camera.eye = [-3.933, 2.855, 27.018];
view1.camera.look = [4.400, 3.724, 8.899];
view1.camera.up = [-0.018, 0.999, 0.039];
view1.camera.projection = PerspectiveProjectionType;
view1.cameraControl.navMode = "orbit";

Create a geometric model representation:

const mySceneModel = myViewer.scene.createModel({
    id: "myModel"
});

mySceneModel.createGeometry({
    id: "myGeometry",
    primitive: constants.TrianglesPrimitive,
    positions: [...],
    indices: [...]
    //...
});

mySceneModel.createMesh({
    id: "myMesh",
    geometryId: "myGeometry",
    //...
});

mySceneModel.createObject({
    id: "myObject",
    meshIds: ["myMesh"],
    viewLayerId: "main"
    //...
});

mySceneModel.build();

Define optional semantic representation for the model:

const myDataModel = myViewer.data.createModel({
    id: "myModel"
});

myDataModel.createObject({
    id: "myObject",
    name: "Some object",
    type: "MyType"
});

Customize the view:

view1.viewObjects["myObject"].highlighted = true;

Readonly onTick

onTick: EventEmitter<Viewer, TickParams>
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:147

Emits an event each time a Viewer "tick" occurs (~10-60 times per second).

Readonly onViewCreated

onViewCreated: EventEmitter<Viewer, View>
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:154

Emits an event each time a View is created.

onViewDestroyed: EventEmitter<Viewer, View>
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:161

Emits an event each time a View is destroyed.

Properties

Readonly capabilities

capabilities: ViewerCapabilities
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:140

Indicates the capabilities of this Viewer.

Readonly data

data: Data
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:176

Contains semantic data about models in this Viewer.

Readonly destroyed

destroyed: boolean
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:135

True once this Viewer has been destroyed.

Don't use this Viewer if this is true.

Readonly id

id: string
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:128

ID of this Viewer.

Readonly localeService

localeService: LocaleService
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:171

Provides locale string translations for this Viewer.

This may be configured via the Viewer's constructor.

By default, this service will be an instance of LocaleService, which will just return null translations for all given strings and phrases.

numViews

numViews: number
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:200

The number of Views belonging to this Viewer.

Readonly scene

scene: Scene
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:181

Contains geometry and materials for models in this viewer.

Readonly startTime

startTime: number = ...
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:211

The time that this Viewer was created.

Readonly viewList

viewList: View[]
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:195

List of all the Views in this Viewer.

Each View is an independently configurable view of the Viewer's models, with its own canvas, camera position, section planes, lights, and object visual states.

Readonly views

views: {}
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:188

Map of all the Views in this Viewer.

Each View is an independently configurable view of the Viewer's models, with its own canvas, camera position, section planes, lights, and object visual states.

Type declaration

  • [key: string]: View

Methods

createView

  • createView(params: ViewParams): View
    • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:296

    Creates a new View within this Viewer.

    • The maximum number of views you're allowed to create is provided in ViewerCapabilities.maxViews. This will be determined by the Renderer implementation the Viewer is configured with.
    • To destroy the View after use, call View.destroy.
    • You must add a View to the Viewer before you can create or load content into the Viewer's Scene.

    Usage

     
    const view1 = myViewer.createView({
     id: "myView",
     canvasId: "myCanvas1"
 });

view1.camera.eye = [-3.933, 2.855, 27.018];
view1.camera.look = [4.400, 3.724, 8.899];
view1.camera.up = [-0.018, 0.999, 0.039];

//...

    Parameters

    • params: ViewParams

    Returns View

destroy

  • destroy(): void
    • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/Viewer.ts:411

    Destroys this Viewer and all Views, SceneModels, DataModels and Plugins we've created within it.

    Returns void
